question: A 1 year old child was brought to OPD with soft, compressible swelling on nose which increases on Coughing. Which of the following is most likely the diagnosis?
exp: Nasal Meningoencephalocele Brain tissue herniates along with its meninges herniates through a bony defect C/F: Soft, cystic, compressible, translucent subcutaneous swelling present at: Root of nose Side of nose Anteromedial aspect of the orbit Swelling show cough implulse (Positive Frustenberg test) and may be reducible Ix -CT/MRI: Rx- Cut the tumor stalk from the brain and repairing the bony defect
topic_name: Tumours of Nose and Paranasal Sinuses

question: Trotter's triad includes all except:
exp: Nasopharyngeal cancer can cause conductive deafness (eustachian tube blockage, ) ipsilateral temporoparietal neuralgia (involvement of CN V) and palatal paralysis (CN X) collectively called Trotters triad.
opa: Sensory disturbance over distribution of 5th cranial nerve
topic_name: Tumours of Nose and Paranasal Sinuses

question: All of the following is true about inveed papilloma of nose except:
exp: Inveed Papilloma/Schneiderian papilloma Arises from the lateral wall of nose Usually unilateral Affects male patients usually Clinically, men are affected more than women in 40-70yrs On examination of nose or endoscopy, it presents as a pale polypoidal mass resembling a simple nasal polyp. Endoscopic Endonasal excision is the current treatment of choice. In 10-15% of cases, it is associated with malignancy.
opa: Arises from the lateral wall of nose
opc: In 5-10% of cases, it is associated with malignancy
opd: Endoscopic Endonasal excision is the treatment of choice
topic_name: Tumours of Nose and Paranasal Sinuses
